data: Dedication to Orion, guardian of the Straits

A rectangular tablet of fine white marble, with a break down the middle and minor chipping to the edges. The rear is lightly convex, and smooth; the remains of a border along the upper rear face suggest the tablet has been re-used for the inscription.
Five lines of Greek letters. The text observes a strict left margin, uneven at the right. The lines are regularly spaced and of equal height.

Lunate Greek letters, neatly and regularly engraved, with only lightly pronounced terminal serifs. Alpha has an upward-sloping cross-bar. Beta is closed with almost equal eyes. Delta and Lambda extend the right hasta above the letter. Theta and Omicron are ovoid in form. Mu generally has vertical first and last strokes,with the middle-point only descending half-way.
Found in secondary deposition in excavations of the mid-1990s in isola 84 at the corner of via E. Geraci and via C. Battisti, Messina
Photo courtesy of archivio fotografico della soprintendenza di Messina
Orione, "Signore di Zancle dal bel porto e del capo Peloro"? Prime osservazioni su un'epigrafe da via Geraci.

A. Ollà, ‘Orione, “Signore Di Zancle Dal Bel Porto e Del Capo Peloro”? Prime Osservazioni Su Un’epigrafe Da via Geraci.’, in Da Zancle a Messina 2016. Nuovi Dati Di Archeologia Urbana, ed. G. Tigano (Palermo: Regione Siciliana, 2017), 173–76
Sulla prima iscrizione metrica da Zancle
Daniele Castrizio e Claudio Meliadò, «Sulla prima iscrizione metrica da Zancle», Zeitschrift für Papyrologie und Epigraphik 213 (2020): 66–71
Miti dello Stretto: Orione al Peloro

Emiliano Arena, «Miti dello Stretto: Orione al Peloro», in Quando parlano i classici. Raccolta Saggi delle edizioni i-vi dell’Agon Zanklaios, a c. di Emiliano Arena e P. Danzè, Lessico & Cultura 13 (Messina, 2020), 121–30

Χαῖρε μάκαρ χθονός ἡμετέρης βλάστημα σεβαστόν Ζάγκλης εὐλιμένου μεδέων ἄκρης τε Πελώρου εἰσορόων στεινόν τε πόρον καὶ ῥεύματα πορθμοῦ ἔνθα πάλιν φοίτοιο διωκομένοιο κλυδῶνος ἀντικορύσσεται Ἀδριακῷ Τυρρηνικόν ὕδωρ
dedication to orion, guardian of the straits
ISic004383. Dedication to Orion, guardian of the Straits

1Χαῖρε μάκαρ χθονός ἡμετέρης βλάστημα σεβαστόν
2Ζάγκλης εὐλιμένου μεδέων ἄκρης τε Πελώρου
3εἰσορόων στεινόν τε πόρον καὶ ῥεύματα πορθμοῦ
4ἔνθα πάλιν φοίτοιο διωκομένοιο κλυδῶνος
5ἀντικορύσσεται Ἀδριακῷ Τυρρηνικόν ὕδωρ

1ΧΑΙΡΕΜΑΚΑΡΧΘΟΝΟΣΗΜΕΤΕΡΗΣΒΛΑΣΤΗΜΑΣΕΒΑΣΤΟΝ
2ΖΑΓΚΛΗΣΕΥΛΙΜΕΝΟΥΜΕΔΕΩΝΑΚΡΗΣΤΕΠΕΛΩΡΟΥ
3ΕΙΣΟΡΟΩΝΣΤΕΙΝΟΝΤΕΠΟΡΟΝΚΑΙΡΕΥΜΑΤΑΠΟΡΘΜΟΥ
4ΕΝΘΑΠΑΛΙΝΦΟΙΤΟΙΟΔΙΩΚΟΜΕΝΟΙΟΚΛΥΔΩΝΟΣ
5ΑΝΤΙΚΟΡΥΣΣΕΤΑΙΑΔΡΙΑΚΩΤΥΡΡΗΝΙΚΟΝΥΔΩΡ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Ollà 2017 and photograph

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Hail, blessed one, august scion of our land, guardian of Zankle with its safe haven, and of Cape Peloros, watching over the narrow firth and the floodtide of the Straits, where, in the unceasing ebb and flow of the pursuing waves, the Tyrrhenian waters take up arms against the Adriatic.

Italian translation

Salve, beato, germoglio venerabile della nostra terra, signore di Zancle dal bel porto e del capo Peloro, tu che guardi lo stretto passaggio e le correnti dello Stretto, dove, essendo l'onda sospinta avanti e indietro, il mar Tirreno si solleva contro l'Adriatico.

commentary

  • Castrizio and Meliadò 2020 66-71 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001491
